dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, hold on. Thirty million? That's, like, how many doses the US government bought?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, hold on. Thirty million? That's, like, how many doses the U S government bought?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: BIG NUMBER 30 million. Thats the number of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine that the U.S. government has purchased, the New York Times reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, um, for the AstraZeneca vaccine. But it’s not even approved here yet, you know? Still in trials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, for the AstraZeneca vaccine. But it's not even approved here yet, you know? Still in trials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the vaccine is yet to be approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and is still undergoing phase-three clinical trials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not approved, but countries are just pausing it left and right. Germany, Netherlands, Ireland... that's a lot of pauses for something "safe."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not approved, but countries are just pausing it left and right. Germany, Netherlands, Ireland... that's a lot of pauses for something safe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nural TOPLINE AstraZeneca on Sunday insisted that is Covid-19 vaccine was safe citing a review of safety data from inoculated people which found no evidence of increased risk of blood clots, as the Netherlands, Ireland and now Germany became the latest countries to suspend the use of the vaccine following reports of possible side effects including blood clots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, but AstraZeneca itself, they just said they reviewed 17 million people, and there's no increased risk of clots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, but AstraZeneca itself, they just said they reviewed seventeen million people, and there's no increased risk of clots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Insisting its vaccine is safe, AstraZeneca said it had reviewed safety data of more than 17 million people vaccinated in the European Union and the U.K. and found no evidence of an increased risk of pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis or thrombocytopenia, in any defined age group, gender, batch or in any particular country, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Of course they said that. It's their vaccine. But what about all these, um, "serious thrombotic events" Germany is talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Of course they said that. It's their vaccine. But what about all these, um, serious thrombotic events Germany is talking about?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany on Monday became the latest country to pause use of the vaccine following a number of serious thrombotic events being investigated by the EU's drugs regulator, according to its vaccines body the Paul Ehrlich institute, which previously labelled the jab as highly effective.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the Paul Ehrlich Institute, they're investigating, but they still, like, call the jab highly effective. And the WHO said it’s unclear if the vaccine is even causing them. These things happen naturally, they said.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the Paul Ehrlich Institute, they're investigating, but they still, like, call the jab highly effective. And the W H O said it's unclear if the vaccine is even causing them. These things happen naturally, they said.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany on Monday became the latest country to pause use of the vaccine following a number of serious thrombotic events being investigated by the EU's drugs regulator, according to its vaccines body the Paul Ehrlich institute, which previously labelled the jab as highly effective. ... Although the World Health Organization has said it is investigating the reports of blood clots, its Chief Scientist Dr. Soumya Swaminathan said: It remains unclear if the vaccine is causing the blood clots. She then added: The adverse events which are reported after vaccination have to be seen in the context of events which occur naturally in the population.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Naturally? When multiple countries suddenly halt a vaccine, um, you gotta wonder if it's more than "natural."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Naturally? When multiple countries suddenly halt a vaccine, um, you gotta wonder if it's more than natural.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's precautionary, though. Like, the Dutch minister said he was optimistic the cases were unrelated, but they can't allow any doubts. That's a good thing, right? To be super careful?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's precautionary, though. Like, the Dutch minister said he was optimistic the cases were unrelated, but they can't allow any doubts. That's a good thing, right? To be super careful?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While no cases of blood clotting were reported in the Netherlands, there was no proof yet of a direct link between the vaccine and blood clots, Dutch Health Minister Hugo de Jonge said, adding: We cant allow any doubts about the vaccine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good for public confidence, maybe. Bad for, like, actually getting shots in arms if everyone's pausing. It sounds messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good for public confidence, maybe. Bad for, like, actually getting shots in arms if everyone's pausing. It sounds messy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it shows they're being thorough. And the EMA, uh, said there's no indication the vaccine caused the death in Austria. It's just a lot of scrutiny.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it shows they're being thorough. And the E M A, uh, said there's no indication the vaccine caused the death in Austria. It's just a lot of scrutiny.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Responding to the development, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) said that a preliminary probe found that there was no indication that the vaccine caused the clotting or the death.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Scrutiny? Or just bad press? They had issues with dosing, European regulators hesitated on older people... it just feels like this vaccine has, um, a cloud over it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Scrutiny? Or just bad press? They had issues with dosing, European regulators hesitated on older people... it just feels like this vaccine has, um, a cloud over it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While trials have shown it to be safe, well-tolerated and effective in preventing disease, phase three trials that included confusion about the use of two separate dosing regimens has led to some bad press. While the vaccine was backed enthusiastically by the U.K. governmentwhich had helped fund its developmentEuropean regulators initially held off on authorizing the vaccine for people older than 65 due to a lack of adequate testing data on the cohort.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But preliminary trials are showing very positive results. And the UK, they backed it from the start, they haven't changed their assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But preliminary trials are showing very positive results. And the U K, they backed it from the start, they haven't changed their assessment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While trials have shown it to be safe, well-tolerated and effective in preventing disease... While the vaccine was backed enthusiastically by the U.K. governmentwhich had helped fund its development...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, okay. So, it's fine, it's safe, everyone's just freaking out over nothing. Got it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, okay. So, it's fine, it's safe, everyone's just freaking out over nothing. Got it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not nothing, exactly, but it's, um, it's about making absolutely sure. It's a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not nothing, exactly, but it's, um, it's about making absolutely sure. It's a huge deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Millions of doses the US bought that aren't even approved. What a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Millions of doses the U S bought that aren't even approved. What a mess.
